movesets.name: Support

items.name: Leftovers
items.description: Heals 1/16 of max HP each turn.

movesets.description:
Moves

Rapid Spin will always be one of the most useful moves in Forretress's arsenal and should thus be considered on any Forretress set. The same goes for Spikes, as Forretress is one of the best users of them, and it also lures in support Arceus for Forretress to Toxic. Toxic is used precisely for these Arceus variants, barring Steel and Poison of course, and it is also useful against other bulky Pokemon without Rest such as Groudon, Giratina-O, and Lugia. The last slot is a slight toss-up between Volt Switch and Gyro Ball. Volt Switch is extremely useful for getting a teammate in safely, escaping Shadow Tag users, and stealing offensive momentum if Forretress is walling the opposition. However, Gyro Ball is also a candidate for this slot, as it is Forretress's best hope of dealing direct damage, 2HKOing Mega Gengar instead of just freeing Forretress from its Shadow Tag. It will also 2HKO any offensive Xerneas variant. Make sure to use a Sassy nature with Gyro Ball. Toxic Spikes is an amazing move and Forretress is one of the best users of them as well. Either Spikes or Toxic can be substituted for Toxic Spikes. Forretress also has a recovery option, outside of Rest, in Pain Split, which will help it stick around longer with the addition of wearing threats with high HP down faster, but Forretress generally has no room for it. All in all, your moveset should depend on what your team needs as Forretress is a supporter with many options.

Set Details

Leftovers gives Forretress a bit more staying power as well as a chance to reactivate Sturdy should Forretress take any premature damage. The EVs are there to patch up Forretress's lackluster Special Defense in the specially based Ubers environment, while its typing and natural physical bulk are all it needs on the physical side. On the contrary, a physically defensive spread could be used along with Pain Split and Toxic to take on Swords Dance Arceus variants better, as well as many other threats such as Mega Kangaskhan, Rock Polish Groudon without Swords Dance, and Landorus-T. Once again, Forretress is a team supporter, so the set you choose should be based around what suits your team best.

Usage Tips

Dedicated spinblockers are less common in Ubers because Defog is the most common method of removing hazards. Should your opponent carry a spinblocker while you have hazards up, using Volt Switch is generally the correct and safest play although poisoning an Arceus-Ghost or Giratina-O switch-in will make them much easier to handle. Forretress can actually set up Spikes after poisoning a Giratina-O and force it to take more Toxic damage as it stays in to Defog. Spikes should be used when your opponent is going to switch or after Forretress has poisoned a support Arceus that can't defeat it, such as Grass Arceus. When an opponent is going to switch, make sure to note how threatening Forretress's switch-in is. If it can be handled easily, then begin to set up Spikes, but if your team is greatly threatened by it, then using Volt Switch and switching into a Pokemon that can check it will be your best course of action. Lastly, Forretress has no recovery outside of the unreliable Pain Split, so make sure to keep it in good heath for as long as possible, as the Spikes and Toxic it carries as well as its ability to Rapid Spin are invaluable in most situations.

Team Options

Forretress is a team supporter and should only exist to help its teammates, but there are a few Pokemon that can make conditions more ideal for Forretress to do its work. The first teammate is Kyogre, as it reduces Forretress's weakness to Fire-type attacks greatly for five turns with the rain that it brings. Forretress also loves receiving Wishes from Wish passers such as Sylveon, Blissey, and Chansey. Tyranitar, Rock Arceus, and Water Arceus all have amazing type synergy with Forretress, and the former also helps Forretress stack on residual damage with sandstorm. Yveltal deserves a special mention as it can remove spinblockers for Forretress, while in return, Forretress can remove Stealth Rock to make Yveltal's switches safer. Mega Gengar can trap and remove Defog users so Forretress's entry hazards aren't wasted before any significant damage is done.

Forretress best supports fragile Pokemon such as Shaymin-S, Deoxys-A, Darkrai, and the previously mentioned Mega Gengar by setting up Spikes to net them KOs that they normally wouldn't get and using its slow Volt Switch to tank a hit and bring them in safely. Forretress also takes priority moves aimed at them very well. Lugia loves having Stealth Rock off its side of the field whilst having Spikes on the opponents side in order to have its phazing shenanigans pack some punch. Ho-Oh adores having Stealth Rock off the field and can shrug off any Fire-type move aimed at Forretress. Fairy-types can use two of Forretress's most dangerous switch-ins, Palkia and Yveltal, as setup bait. Forretress generally does better on offensively inclined teams that are able to apply enough pressure to Defog and Rapid Spin users to keep them off the field or punish a turn of clearing entry hazards with a sweep. The Spikes Forretress provides will aid sweepers in tearing apart teams, and Toxic can help wear down walls and tanks so sweepers can break through them easier.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Autotomize
moves.description: Boosts user's Speed by 2 stages. Reduces user's weight.

moves.name: Bide
moves.description: Charges for 2-3 turns; returns double the damage received in those turns.

moves.name: Block
moves.description: The target cannot switch out.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Bug Bite
moves.description: Uses foe's Berry.

moves.name: Bulldoze
moves.description: Lowers target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Counter
moves.description: If hit by a physical attack, returns double the damage.

moves.name: Defense Curl
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dig
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Drill Run
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Earthquake
moves.description: Hits Pokemon using Dig with double Base Power.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Explosion
moves.description: Faints the user.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Flail
moves.description: Does more damage as HP decreases.

moves.name: Flash Cannon
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Giga Drain
moves.description: Leeches 50% damage.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Gravity
moves.description: For 5 turns, prevents flying or jumping; also disables Ground immunities.

moves.name: Gyro Ball
moves.description: Does damage based on the foe's Speed and the user's Speed.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch the target.

moves.name: Heavy Slam
moves.description: Deals damage based on both the user's and the target's weight.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Dark
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Dragon
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Electric
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Fighting
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Fire
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Flying
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Ghost
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Grass
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Ground
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Ice
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Poison
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Psychic
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Rock
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Steel
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Water
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Iron Defense
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Light Screen
moves.description: Lowers damage from special attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Magnet Rise
moves.description: User becomes immune to Ground moves for 5 turns.

moves.name: Mimic
moves.description: Copies the last move used by the target.

moves.name: Mirror Shot
moves.description: 30% chance to lower accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Pain Split
moves.description: Averages both Pokemon's HP.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Pin Missile
moves.description: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

moves.name: Power Trick
moves.description: Swaps user's Attack and Defense stats.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Rapid Spin
moves.description: Removes Leech Seed and Spikes.

moves.name: Reflect
moves.description: Lowers damage from physical attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Refresh
moves.description: Removes status.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Revenge
moves.description: Doubles in power if damaged.

moves.name: Rock Polish
moves.description: Boosts Speed by 2 stages.

moves.name: Rock Slide
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Rock Smash
moves.description: 50% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Rock Tomb
moves.description: Lowers Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Rollout
moves.description: Doubles in power with each hit. Repeats for 5 turns.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Sand Tomb
moves.description: Traps and damages target for 4-5 turns.

moves.name: Sandstorm
moves.description: Summons a sandstorm for 5 turns.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Self-Destruct
moves.description: Faints the user.

moves.name: Signal Beam
moves.description: 10% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Solar Beam
moves.description: Charges up turn 1; attacks on turn 2.

moves.name: Spikes
moves.description: Causes damage to the enemy whenever they switch.

moves.name: Stealth Rock
moves.description: Damages foe's switch-ins.

moves.name: Strength
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: String Shot
moves.description: Lowers foe's Speed 1 stage.

moves.name: Struggle Bug
moves.description: Lowers target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swift
moves.description: Always hits.

moves.name: Tackle
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Take Down
moves.description: Has 1/4 recoil.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Toxic Spikes
moves.description: Poisons opponents as they switch switch in.

moves.name: Venoshock
moves.description: Hits poisoned targets with double Base Power.

moves.name: Volt Switch
moves.description: Forces user to switch.

moves.name: Zap Cannon
moves.description: Paralyzes the foe.

abilities.name: Overcoat
abilities.description: Grants immunity to damage from weather effects and powder moves.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: The weilder cannot be KO'd in one hit. OHKO moves will fail.
